transcript.title: Visit to Australia by the President of Malta
transcript.content:
The President of Malta, HE Dr Fenech Adami, will visit Australia from 21-28 February to discuss opportunities to further strengthen the warm relationship between our two countries.

President Fenech Adami will visit the ACT, NSW, Queensland and Victoria to meet with the Maltese community in Australia.

He will attend the National Day of Mourning Memorial Service for the Victorian bushfire victims on Sunday.

Australia and Malta have a friendly and constructive relationship based on strong people-to-people and historical links.

The large and respected Maltese community in Australia makes a valuable contribution to Australia's vibrant culture. There are currently around 153,000 Australians of Maltese ancestry living in Australia and around 43,000 Australian residents were born in Malta.

Malta is a member of the European Union and President Fenech Adami's visit reflects a new era of creative engagement between Australia and Europe.

Australia's reinvigorated relationship with the European Union is founded on the Australia-European Union Partnership Framework Agreement signed in Paris in October 2008.
